qas.question: How far do penguins travel when they migrate?
How do Emus migrate long distances during droughts?

context: Bird migration is not limited to birds that can fly. Most species of penguin (Spheniscidae) migrate <a0_0>by swimming<a0_0/>. These routes can cover <a1_0>over 1,000 km<a1_0/> (620 mi). Dusky grouse Dendragapus obscurus perform altitudinal migration <a2_0>mostly by walking<a2_0/>. Emus Dromaius novaehollandiae in <a4_0>Australia<a4_0/> have been observed to undertake long-distance movements <a3_0>on foot<a3_0/> during droughts.
